properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 9 at 9:53PM MST until February 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW OVER PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL
NEW MEXICO TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING...

...COLDER TEMPERATURES, MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW, AND WINDY
CONDITIONS THEN ARRIVE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...

.An upper level disturbance and surface cold front will combine
to bring light to occasionally moderate snow to portions of
western and central New Mexico later tonight through Monday
morning. Areas most likely to observe accumulations will be found
along the central mountain chain. A brief break in the wintry
weather is then expected Monday afternoon, however a more
significant winter storm will move over New Mexico Monday night
through Tuesday night when many areas of northern and central New
Mexico can expect moderate to heavy snowfall and colder
temperatures. In addition, periods of strong and gusty winds will
create areas of blowing snow in central New Mexico. Residents and
travelers through much of northern and central New Mexico can
expect significant travel impacts Monday night through Tuesday
night.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8
inches in lower elevations with higher amounts of 8 to 14
inches above 7500 feet. Locally higher amounts possible on the
highest mountain peaks. Winds gusting as high as 35 to 55 mph
in some central areas.

* WHERE...Northern and central New Mexico.

* WHEN...From late Monday evening through Tuesday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING
